result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L. Beekman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 10 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 11/1/15
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel L. Beekman

Prior: 824 S. Spring St. - Apt A, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Defendant Samuel L. Beekman in court with attorney Eugene Joseph Kirschbaum.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, penalties, PW&WOR. Def pleads  NC to ct. 1 Bail Jumping. Court finds factual basis, find plea made FV&K, accepts plea and finds def guilty of Ct. 1 Bail Jumping. Atty Thompson heard, and excused. Atty Sempf now appears for the State. Atty Kirschbaum heard. Def makes statement. Court heard and imposes sent of:
sent w/h
1 yr P&P
10 days jail on or before 11/1/15
AODA and any counseling by agent
DNA sample on request
Costs - to include DNA surcharge
Absolute Sobriety

Defendant Samuel L. Beekman in court with attorney Eugene Joseph Kirschbaum.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court removes from JT calendar; to track with Br 3 case 15CM114; sets for Status Conference after RD in underlying case.  Return date scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Return date at 07-13-2015 01:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference at 08-14-2015 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant Samuel L. Beekman in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; State heard on bond: $3,000 Cash w/conditions; Court finds probable cause. RD 6/22/15 at 1:30pm & JT 8/5/15 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets $750 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. (Court does not order the no contact provision)
